FacilityName: Sunoco Partners Mktg. and Terminal LP Columbus, OH
SafetyInspectionBy: OH Dept. of Commerce, Office State Fire Marshal

_prev_prog_3.PC_OtherType: Fill alarm at 80% with auto.  Shutoff at 85%, min. Class 1 Div. 1 electric w/in 5 ft. of all transfer (truck offloading) points w/Class 1 Div. 2 from 5-15 feet, Class 1 Div. 2 w/in 15 ft. of remainder
_prev_prog_3.MD_OtherType: Hydrocarbon detectors, flow monitoring, temperature, pressure & liquid level indicators
_prev_prog_3.CH_OtherChanges: Installation of additional security lighting, surveillance cameras, and flow diversion structure
_prev_prog_3.Description: Butane (1x60,000 gallon plus lines, liquefied and stored under pressure), blending system involving direct injection into refined product (gasoline) pipelines with bulk truck offloading.  System operations are anticipated to occur primarily during the "cold" season.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal Butane Blending System was constructed in accordance with the National Fire Protection Association (NFPA Code) #58 (2011 Edition) for Liquefied Petroleum Gas Storage, and it is the facility's policy to adhere to all applicable federal, state and local laws/codes.  It is the intent of the Columbus West Terminal to incorporate the most recent construction and procedural guidance (NFPA #58-2011 Edition) into this process.  If an emergency were to occur, it is the facility's policy to notify the Columbus Fire Department as well as the Franklin County Emergency Management.  Medical emergencies will require notification of the local Emergency Medical Services (Columbus Fire Department EMS Division) and Mount Carmel West Hospital.

Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal is a bulk petroleum storage and distribution facility that includes butane blending operations.  The Risk Management Plan (RMP) covers the butane blending system, including the associated piping and one (1) 60,000 gallon (water capacity) butane storage vessel.

The facility's worst case scenario is the failure of the system 60,000 gallon butane storage vessel when filled to the greatest amount allowed (85% fill shut-off with alarm at 80%) resulting in a vapor cloud explosion.  The facility's alternate (potential for off-site impacts) release scenario is a "BLEVE" accident and associated fireball.

Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal complies with the U.S. Environmental Protection Agency's (EPA) Accident Prevention Rules (40 CFR Part 68 Subpart D), the Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) Process Safety Management (PSM) standard (29 CFR Part 1910.119) along with its fourteen (14) compliance elements, and all applicable state and local laws and regulations.  The butane blending system is designed, constructed, and maintained in accordance with NFPA #58 and the manufactu

rer's (Sunoco Partners Butane Blending, LLC) specifications.

As this is a new system, this facility has never had an accident involving the butane process which has resulted in deaths, injuries, property/environmental damage, evacuations or sheltering in place.

In the event of an emergency involving the Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP - Columbus West Terminal butane blending system, it is the policy of the facility to initially contact the Columbus Fire Department (Primary Responder, Station #26) and request their assistance.  The facility emergency response plans are coordinated with fire department and the Franklin County Emergency Management.  The Columbus Fire Department has participated in the initial RMP/PSM training sessions for this system.

Process safety controls include excess flow valves, low-melting point (thermal protection) pneumatic valve feeds to pneumatic valves (fail closed), 85% fill shut-off (80% alarm and 90% ESD actuation) on the vessel, emergency shut-off devices on the system and video display terminal, line thermal/hydrostatic reliefs, and grounding interlock devices.

In an effort to improve and promote system safety, Sunoco Partners Marketing & Terminals, LP looks for, and seeks employee input, on process safety improvements.  Additionally, the Columbus Fire Department is contacted regarding participation in site emergency response drills.  Additional actions include consolidating separate system inspection checklists for ease of completion.
